item.title: 德国初创公司的太空火箭从挪威起飞数秒后爆炸
item.description: 周日，一枚旨在启动从欧洲发射卫星的试验火箭从挪威太空港起飞40秒后坠地爆炸，德国初创公司伊萨尔宇航公司（Isar Aerospace）称这是一次初步试验。【原文：A test rocket aimed at kickstarting satellite launches from Europe fell to the ground and exploded 40 seconds after takeoff from a Norwegian space port on Sunday, in what German startup Isar Aerospace had described as an initial test.】

item.title: 首次成功后，中国脑芯片项目加速人体试验
item.description: 一家中国研究机构和科技公司周一表示，该公司的目标是在今年年底前为 13 人植入大脑芯片，此举可能使其在收集患者数据方面超越埃隆-马斯克的 Neuralink 公司。【原文：A tie-up between a Chinese research institute and tech company said on Monday that it aims to implant its brain chip into 13 people by the end of this year, in a move that could see it overtake Elon Musk's Neuralink in collecting patient data.】

item.title: 欧洲央行帕内塔：美国贸易政策要求欧洲央行谨慎降息
item.description: 欧洲央行管理委员会成员法比奥-帕内塔（Fabio Panetta）周一表示，主要由于美国宣布贸易政策而导致的高度不确定性意味着欧洲央行在降低利率时需要谨慎。【原文：High uncertainty, mainly due to U.S. trade policy announcements, means the European Central Bank needs to be cautious in reducing its interest rates, governing council member Fabio Panetta said on Monday.】

item.title: 英国维珍航空自大流行病以来首次恢复盈利
item.description: 理查德-布兰森（Richard Branson）拥有多数股权的英国维珍航空（Virgin Atlantic）表示，自去年大流行病以来，该公司首次恢复盈利。【原文：Virgin Atlantic, the British airline majority owned by Richard Branson, said it returned to profitability for the first time since the pandemic last year.】

item.title: 维珍航空发现美国需求放缓的信号
item.description: 英国维珍航空公司（Virgin Atlantic）表示，在经历了2025年的强劲开局后，它开始看到美国需求放缓的一些信号。【原文：British airline Virgin Atlantic said it was starting to see some signals that demand was slowing in the United States after a strong start to 2025.】

item.title: 法国反垄断监管机构就隐私工具对苹果处以 1.5 亿欧元罚款
item.description: 法国反垄断监管机构周一对苹果公司处以 1.5 亿欧元（1.6236 亿美元）的罚款，原因是苹果公司在 2021 年至 2023 年期间，通过一款名为 ATT 的隐私控制工具，在 iOS 和 iPadOS 设备上滥用其移动应用广告的主导地位。【原文：France's antitrust regulator on Monday fined Apple 150 million euros ($162.36 million) for abusing its dominant position in mobile app advertising on iOS and iPadOS devices between 2021 and 2023 via a privacy control tool called ATT.】

item.title: 中国华为 2024 年利润下降，营收五年来增长最快
item.description: 中国华为技术公司（HWT.UL）周一表示，2024 年的利润与上年同期相比下降了近四分之一，当时出售荣耀手机业务带来的收入促进了公司的盈利，而公司的收入则实现了五年来最快的增长。【原文：China's Huawei Technologies (HWT.UL) said on Monday its profit fell by almost a quarter in 2024 versus a year prior when income from the sale of its Honor handset unit provided an earnings boost, while its revenue grew at the fastest rate in five years.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德：特朗普的关税意味着欧洲必须掌控自己的未来
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（ECB）行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）周一表示，美国可能于4月2日加征关税，这意味着欧洲必须更好地掌控自己的未来。【原文：The likely implementation of tariffs imposed by the United States on April 2 means Europe will have to take better control of its future, European Central Bank (ECB) head Christine Lagarde said on Monday.】

item.title: Primark 老板 Paul Marchant 在 "判断失误 "后辞职
item.description: 英国联合食品公司（Associated British Foods）称，其 Primark 服装业务的老板 Paul Marchant 已辞职，辞职立即生效，因为有个人指控他在社交环境中对她的行为。【原文：Associated British Foods said the boss of its Primark clothing business, Paul Marchant, has resigned with immediate effect following an allegation made by an individual about his behaviour towards her in a social environment.】

item.title: 阿斯顿-马丁再获 6800 万美元融资，将出售 F1 车队股份
item.description: 阿斯顿-马丁周一表示，董事长劳伦斯-斯特罗尔（Lawrence Stroll）的紫杉集团（Yew Tree Consortium）将向这家豪华汽车制造商再投资5250万英镑（6798万美元），并将持股比例增至约33%。【原文：Aston Martin said on Monday Chairman Lawrence Stroll's Yew Tree Consortium would invest a further 52.5 million pounds ($67.98 million) in the luxury carmaker and increase its stake to about 33%.】

item.title: 早间竞价：特朗普吹嘘对所有人征收关税，风险资产遭践踏
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole】

item.title: 独家报道老兄，我的车呢？在混合动力车热潮中，丰田买家面临漫长等待
item.description: 据四位熟知内情的人士透露，丰田汽油-电力混合动力汽车需求的飙升已使供应商难以跟上步伐，导致零部件短缺，购车者需要等待数月之久。【原文：Soaring demand for Toyota's gasoline-electric hybrids has left suppliers struggling to keep pace, leading to shortages of parts and months-long waits for car buyers, according to four people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚央行董事会可能恢复减持，新成员首次亮相
item.description: 尽管面临通胀压力和财政困难，哥伦比亚中央银行董事会周一仍将在新董事会成员的支持下恢复基准利率的下调。【原文：Colombia's central bank board looks set on Monday to resume cuts to its benchmark interest rate with the support of new board members, despite inflation pressures and a difficult fiscal situation.】

item.title: 美国风险溢价缩减，更多现金流入欧洲
item.description: 投资者持有美国国债比持有德国国债所享有的溢价将创下多年来的最大季度跌幅，大西洋两岸财政政策的结构性转变预计将进一步缩小这一差距，从而吸引更多现金流向欧洲。【原文：The premium investors enjoy from holding U.S. government debt over that of Germany is set for its biggest quarterly drop in years, with tectonic fiscal policy shifts on both sides of the Atlantic expected to shrink this gap further, luring more cash to Europe.】

item.title: 石油市场静观特朗普威胁征收俄罗斯石油关税是否虚张声势
item.description: 周一，石油市场对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁要对俄罗斯石油买家征收关税的言论无动于衷，因为白宫发出的一系列威胁所带来的震撼已开始让厌倦的交易商们感到厌倦。【原文：Oil markets on Monday shrugged off U.S. President Donald Trump's threat to hit buyers of Russian oil with tariffs as the shock value of the barrage of threats from the White House begins to wear thin with jaded traders.】

item.title: 中国智璞人工智能公司推出免费人工智能代理，加剧国内技术竞争
item.description: 中国人工智能初创公司智普人工智能（Zhipu AI）周一发布了一款免费的人工智能代理，加入了中国竞争日益激烈的人工智能市场的类似发布浪潮。【原文：Chinese artificial intelligence startup Zhipu AI unveiled a free AI agent on Monday, joining a wave of similar launches in China's increasingly competitive AI market.】

item.title: 台积电在海外扩张的同时，在台湾新建国内晶圆厂，确认对台湾的承诺
item.description: 台积电周一表示，其新建的国内晶圆厂将为台湾经济增加 7000 个技术岗位，并将继续在台湾扩张。【原文：TSMC said on Monday that its newly built domestic fab would add 7,000 tech jobs to the island's economy and that it will continue to expand in Taiwan, following concern that its investment in the U.S. will dilute its presence at home.】

item.title: 高盛预计美国联邦储备委员会 2025 年将降息三次
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）以关税不确定性为由，目前预计美国联邦储备委员会今年将降息三个季度点。 这家华尔街经纪公司在周日的一份说明中表示，预计今年将在7月、9月和11月连续降息三次，而之前的预测是在6月和12月降息两次。【原文：Goldman Sachs now expects the U.S. Federal Reserve to deliver three quarter point interest rate cuts this year, citing tariff uncertainty. The Wall Street brokereage expects three consecutive cuts this year in July, September, and November, compared to its previous forecast of two cuts in June and December, it said in a note on Sunday.】

item.title: 让欧洲再次伟大 "的贸易正获得牵引力
item.description: 一个更加独立、不那么依赖美国的欧洲正在形成，投资者在这个被长期回避的地区感受到的机会不仅仅是抢购国防股票。【原文：A more independent, less U.S.-reliant Europe is taking shape and investors sense opportunities in a long-shunned region that go beyond just snapping up defence shares.】

item.title: 对中国和美国公司而言，特朗普的贸易战这次更可怕
item.description: 中国供应商和他们的美国客户现在正在面对严峻的现实，即这场贸易战将在 2018 年给特朗普的第一个任期带来更严重的冲击。【原文：Chinese suppliers and their American clients are now coming to grips with the grim reality that this trade war will hit harder than in Trump's first term in 2018.】

item.title: 贸易战困境推动黄金屡创新高
item.description: 由于担心美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税计划会引发全球贸易战和经济后果，投资者纷纷转向避险资产，黄金周一触及历史新高，突破了3,100美元的水平。【原文：Gold touched an all-time high on Monday, breaching the $3,100 level, as investors turned to the safe-haven asset amid concerns that U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff plans would stoke a global trade war and economic fallout.】

item.title: 日本财务大臣称将就外汇问题与美国密切沟通
item.description: 日本财务大臣加藤胜信周一表示，他将与美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）就外汇问题进行密切沟通，并指出密切对话对市场稳定非常重要。【原文：Japan Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato said on Monday that he would communicate closely with U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on foreign exchange, pointing out that close dialogue is important for market stability.】

item.title: 美国关税和不确定性推动避险资金流入，黄金飙升突破 3100 美元
item.description: 周一，金价首次飙升至每盎司 3100 美元以上，原因是对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税和潜在经济影响的担忧，以及对地缘政治的担忧，推动了新一轮对避险资产的投资热潮。【原文：Gold prices on Monday soared above $3,100 per ounce for the first time as concerns around U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs and the potential economic fallout, combined with geopolitical worries, drove a fresh wave of investments into the safe-haven asset.】

item.title: 台湾总统在美国可能征收关税前听取简报
item.description: 台湾总统赖清德办公室周一表示，赖清德总统周日晚会见了高级官员，讨论了美国关税可能带来的影响，并听取了应急计划的最新进展。【原文：Taiwan President Lai Ching-te met senior officials on Sunday night to discuss the possible impact of U.S. tariffs and receive an update on contingency plans, his office said on Monday.】

item.title: 订单强劲，中国制造业创 12 个月新高
item.description: 周一的一项工厂调查显示，中国制造业活动在 3 月份以一年来最快的速度扩张，新订单促进了生产，使这个世界第二大经济体在应对愈演愈烈的美国贸易战时得到了一些缓解。【原文：China's manufacturing activity expanded at the fastest pace in a year in March, a factory survey showed on Monday, with new orders boosting production, giving the world's No.2 economy some reprieve as it deals with an intensifying U.S. trade war.】

item.title: 中国国有媒体批评港口交易，长江和记股价下跌 4.5%
item.description: 长江和记 0001.HK 股价周一最多下跌了 4.7%，此前中国国家媒体批评了这家香港企业集团的巴拿马港口交易，消息人士称，预计于 4 月 2 日签署的交易将被推迟。【原文：Shares of CK Hutchison 0001.HK fell as much as 4.7% on Monday after China state media criticised the Hong Kong conglomerate's Panama port deal and sources said the deal, which was expected to be signed on April 2, would be delayed.】

item.title: 日元上涨，黄金创历史新高，关税忧虑点燃避险需求
item.description: 由于交易商担心美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税政策将引发通货膨胀并抑制经济增长，避险货币日元周一上涨，而黄金则升至历史新高。【原文：The safe-haven Japanese yen rose on Monday while gold pushed to a fresh all-time peak as traders worried that U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs will ignite inflation and crimp economic growth.】

item.title: 尽管特朗普警告可能对俄罗斯买家征收关税，但油价仍有所松动
item.description: 尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普警告说，如果他认为莫斯科阻碍了他结束乌克兰战争的努力，他可能会对俄罗斯石油的买家征收二级关税，但周一油价仍有所回落，有望实现季度微跌。【原文：Oil prices eased on Monday, heading for a slight quarterly loss despite a warning by U.S. President Donald Trump that he may impose secondary tariffs on buyers of Russian oil if he feels Moscow is blocking his efforts to end the war in Ukraine.】

item.title: 新华社：中国海洋石油总公司在南海发现亿吨级油田
item.description: 据新华社周一报道，中国海洋石油总公司（中海油）在南海发现了一个探明储量超过 1 亿吨的油田。【原文：The China National Offshore Oil Corporation (CNOOC) has discovered an oilfield in the South China Sea with proven reserves exceeding 100 million tonnes, Xinhua news agency reported on Monday.】

item.title: 香港长江和记表示尚未决定电信公司分拆事宜
item.description: 香港企业集团长江和记董事会周一表示，针对媒体有关其全球电信业务可能分拆上市的报道，该公司尚未作出任何决定。【原文：The board of Hong Kong conglomerate CK Hutchison said on Monday it has not made any decision on its global telecommunications business, in response to media reports about a potential spin-off listing of the assets.】
